programName: Enter the Matrix of rows and columns entered by the user and print in matrix format
code: // Enter the Matrix of rows and columns entered by the user and print in matrix format import java.util.Scanner; public class program1 { public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in); // Input the number of rows and columns from the user System.out.print("Enter the number of rows: "); int rows = scanner.nextInt(); System.out.print("Enter the number of columns: "); int columns = scanner.nextInt(); // Input the matrix elements from the user int[][] matrix = new int[rows][columns]; System.out.println("Enter the matrix elements:"); for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) { for (int j = 0; j < columns; j++) { System.out.print("Enter element at position (" + (i + 1) + "," + (j + 1) + "): "); matrix[i][j] = scanner.nextInt(); } } // Print the matrix in matrix format System.out.println("Matrix:"); for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) { for (int j = 0; j < columns; j++) { System.out.print(matrix[i][j] + " "); } System.out.println(); // Move to the next line for the next row } // Close the scanner scanner.close(); } }
output:
Enter the number of rows:  
3
Enter the number of columns: 2
Enter the matrix elements:
Enter element at position (1,1): 10
Enter element at position (1,2): 50
Enter element at position (2,1): 40
Enter element at position (2,2): 1
Enter element at position (3,1): 6
Enter element at position (3,2): 8
Matrix:
10      50
40      1
6       8

code: // Program to Add Two Matrices import java.util.Scanner; public class program2 { public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in); // Input the dimensions of the matrices System.out.print("Enter the number of rows: "); int rows = scanner.nextInt(); System.out.print("Enter the number of columns: "); int columns = scanner.nextInt(); // Input the elements of the first matrix System.out.println("Enter the elements of the first matrix:"); int[][] matrix1 = inputMatrix(rows, columns, scanner); // Input the elements of the second matrix System.out.println("Enter the elements of the second matrix:"); int[][] matrix2 = inputMatrix(rows, columns, scanner); // Add the matrices and print the result System.out.println("Sum of the matrices:"); printMatrix(addMatrices(matrix1, matrix2)); // Close the scanner scanner.close(); } public static int[][] inputMatrix(int rows, int columns, Scanner scanner) { int[][] matrix = new int[rows][columns]; for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) { for (int j = 0; j < columns; j++) { System.out.print("Enter element at position (" + (i + 1) + "," + (j + 1) + "): "); matrix[i][j] = scanner.nextInt(); } } return matrix; } public static int[][] addMatrices(int[][] matrix1, int[][] matrix2) { int rows = matrix1.length; int columns = matrix1[0].length; int[][] sumMatrix = new int[rows][columns]; for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) { for (int j = 0; j < columns; j++) { sumMatrix[i][j] = matrix1[i][j] + matrix2[i][j]; } } return sumMatrix; } public static void printMatrix(int[][] matrix) { for (int[] row : matrix) { for (int element : row) { System.out.print(element + " "); } System.out.println(); // Move to the next line for the next row } } }

code: // Program to Multiply Two Matrices import java.util.Scanner; public class program3 { public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in); // Input the dimensions of the first matrix System.out.print("Enter the number of rows for the first matrix: "); int rows1 = scanner.nextInt(); System.out.print("Enter the number of columns for the first matrix: "); int columns1 = scanner.nextInt(); // Input the elements of the first matrix int[][] matrix1 = inputMatrix(rows1, columns1, "first", scanner); // Input the dimensions of the second matrix System.out.print("Enter the number of rows for the second matrix: "); int rows2 = scanner.nextInt(); System.out.print("Enter the number of columns for the second matrix: "); int columns2 = scanner.nextInt(); // Input the elements of the second matrix int[][] matrix2 = inputMatrix(rows2, columns2, "second", scanner); // Check if matrices can be multiplied if (columns1 != rows2) { System.out.println("Matrices cannot be multiplied. Number of columns in the first matrix must be equal to the number of rows in the second matrix."); } else { // Multiply the matrices int[][] productMatrix = multiplyMatrices(matrix1, matrix2); // Print the result matrix System.out.println("Product of the matrices:"); printMatrix(productMatrix); } // Close the scanner scanner.close(); } public static int[][] inputMatrix(int rows, int columns, String ordinal, Scanner scanner) { System.out.println("Enter the elements of the " + ordinal + " matrix:"); int[][] matrix = new int[rows][columns]; for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) { for (int j = 0; j < columns; j++) { System.out.print("Enter element at position (" + (i + 1) + "," + (j + 1) + "): "); matrix[i][j] = scanner.nextInt(); } } return matrix; } public static int[][] multiplyMatrices(int[][] matrix1, int[][] matrix2) { int rows1 = matrix1.length; int columns1 = matrix1[0].length; int rows2 = matrix2.length; int columns2 = matrix2[0].length; int[][] productMatrix = new int[rows1][columns2]; for (int i = 0; i < rows1; i++) { for (int j = 0; j < columns2; j++) { for (int k = 0; k < columns1; k++) { productMatrix[i][j] += matrix1[i][k] * matrix2[k][j]; } } } return productMatrix; } public static void printMatrix(int[][] matrix) { for (int[] row : matrix) { for (int element : row) { System.out.print(element + " "); } System.out.println(); // Move to the next line for the next row } } }

programName: Program to subtract the two matrices
code: // Program to subtract the two matrices import java.util.Scanner; public class program4 { public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in); // Input the dimensions of the matrices System.out.print("Enter the number of rows: "); int rows = scanner.nextInt(); System.out.print("Enter the number of columns: "); int columns = scanner.nextInt(); // Input the elements of the first matrix int[][] matrix1 = inputMatrix("first", rows, columns, scanner); // Input the elements of the second matrix int[][] matrix2 = inputMatrix("second", rows, columns, scanner); // Subtract the matrices int[][] differenceMatrix = subtractMatrices(matrix1, matrix2); // Print the result matrix System.out.println("Difference of the matrices:"); printMatrix(differenceMatrix); // Close the scanner scanner.close(); } public static int[][] inputMatrix(String ordinal, int rows, int columns, Scanner scanner) { System.out.println("Enter the elements of the " + ordinal + " matrix:"); int[][] matrix = new int[rows][columns]; for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) { for (int j = 0; j < columns; j++) { System.out.print("Enter element at position (" + (i + 1) + "," + (j + 1) + "): "); matrix[i][j] = scanner.nextInt(); } } return matrix; } public static int[][] subtractMatrices(int[][] matrix1, int[][] matrix2) { int rows = matrix1.length; int columns = matrix1[0].length; int[][] differenceMatrix = new int[rows][columns]; for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) { for (int j = 0; j < columns; j++) { differenceMatrix[i][j] = matrix1[i][j] - matrix2[i][j]; } } return differenceMatrix; } public static void printMatrix(int[][] matrix) { for (int[] row : matrix) { for (int element : row) { System.out.print(element + " "); } System.out.println(); // Move to the next line for the next row } } }
output:
Enter the number of rows: 2
        Enter the number of columns: 2
        Enter the elements of the first matrix:
        Enter element at position (1,1): 5
        Enter element at position (1,2): 6
        Enter element at position (2,1): 3
        Enter element at position (2,2): 4
        Enter the elements of the second matrix:
        Enter element at position (1,1): 2
        Enter element at position (1,2): 6
        Enter element at position (2,1): 4
        Enter element at position (2,2): 8
        Difference of the matrices:
        3       0
        -1      -4

programName: Program to determine whether two matrices are equal
code: // Program to determine whether two matrices are equal import java.util.Scanner; public class program5 { public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in); // Input the dimensions of the matrices System.out.print("Enter the number of rows: "); int rows = scanner.nextInt(); System.out.print("Enter the number of columns: "); int columns = scanner.nextInt(); // Input the elements of the first matrix int[][] matrix1 = inputMatrix("first", rows, columns, scanner); // Input the elements of the second matrix int[][] matrix2 = inputMatrix("second", rows, columns, scanner); // Check if the matrices are equal boolean areEqual = areMatricesEqual(matrix1, matrix2); // Print the result if (areEqual) { System.out.println("The matrices are equal."); } else { System.out.println("The matrices are not equal."); } // Close the scanner scanner.close(); } public static int[][] inputMatrix(String ordinal, int rows, int columns, Scanner scanner) { System.out.println("Enter the elements of the " + ordinal + " matrix:"); int[][] matrix = new int[rows][columns]; for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) { for (int j = 0; j < columns; j++) { System.out.print("Enter element at position (" + (i + 1) + "," + (j + 1) + "): "); matrix[i][j] = scanner.nextInt(); } } return matrix; } public static boolean areMatricesEqual(int[][] matrix1, int[][] matrix2) { int rows = matrix1.length; int columns = matrix1[0].length; if (matrix2.length != rows || matrix2[0].length != columns) { return false; // Matrices have different dimensions } for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) { for (int j = 0; j < columns; j++) { if (matrix1[i][j] != matrix2[i][j]) { return false; // Matrices have different elements } } } return true; // Matrices are equal } }
output:
Enter the number of rows: 2
Enter the number of columns: 2
Enter the elements of the first matrix:
Enter element at position (1,1): 6
Enter element at position (1,2): 
56
Enter element at position (2,1): 3
Enter element at position (2,2): 4
Enter the elements of the second matrix:
Enter element at position (1,1): 2
Enter element at position (1,2): 5
Enter element at position (2,1): 8
Enter element at position (2,2): 1
The matrices are not equal.

programName: Program to display the lower triangular matrix
code: // Program to display the lower triangular matrix import java.util.Scanner; public class program6 { public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in); // Input the size of the square matrix System.out.print("Enter the size of the square matrix: "); int size = scanner.nextInt(); // Input the elements of the square matrix int[][] matrix = inputSquareMatrix(size, scanner); // Display the lower triangular matrix System.out.println("Lower Triangular Matrix:"); displayLowerTriangularMatrix(matrix); // Close the scanner scanner.close(); } public static int[][] inputSquareMatrix(int size, Scanner scanner) { System.out.println("Enter the elements of the square matrix:"); int[][] matrix = new int[size][size]; for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) { for (int j = 0; j < size; j++) { System.out.print("Enter element at position (" + (i + 1) + "," + (j + 1) + "): "); matrix[i][j] = scanner.nextInt(); } } return matrix; } public static void displayLowerTriangularMatrix(int[][] matrix) { int size = matrix.length; for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) { for (int j = 0; j < size; j++) { if (j <= i) { System.out.print(matrix[i][j] + " "); } else { System.out.print("0 "); // Print 0 for elements above the main diagonal } } System.out.println(); // Move to the next line for the next row } } }
output:
Enter the size of the square matrix: 3
Enter the elements of the square matrix:
Enter element at position (1,1): 2
Enter element at position (1,2): 5
Enter element at position (1,3): 6
Enter element at position (2,1): 8
Enter element at position (2,2): 4
Enter element at position (2,3): 2
Enter element at position (3,1): 0
Enter element at position (3,2): 4
Enter element at position (3,3): 5
Lower Triangular Matrix:
2       0       0
8       4       0
0       4       5

programName: Program to display the upper triangular matrix
code: // Program to display the upper triangular matrix import java.util.Scanner; public class UpperTriangularMatrix { public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in); // Input the size of the square matrix System.out.print("Enter the size of the square matrix: "); int size = scanner.nextInt(); // Input the elements of the square matrix int[][] matrix = inputSquareMatrix(size, scanner); // Display the upper triangular matrix System.out.println("Upper Triangular Matrix:"); displayUpperTriangularMatrix(matrix); // Close the scanner scanner.close(); } public static int[][] inputSquareMatrix(int size, Scanner scanner) { System.out.println("Enter the elements of the square matrix:"); int[][] matrix = new int[size][size]; for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) { for (int j = 0; j < size; j++) { System.out.print("Enter element at position (" + (i + 1) + "," + (j + 1) + "): "); matrix[i][j] = scanner.nextInt(); } } return matrix; } public static void displayUpperTriangularMatrix(int[][] matrix) { int size = matrix.length; for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) { for (int j = 0; j < size; j++) { if (j >= i) { System.out.print(matrix[i][j] + " "); } else { System.out.print("0 "); // Print 0 for elements below the main diagonal } } System.out.println(); // Move to the next line for the next row } } }

programName: Program to find the frequency of odd & even numbers in the given matrix
code: // Program to find the frequency of odd & even numbers in the given matrix import java.util.Scanner; public class program8 { public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in); // Input the size of the matrix System.out.print("Enter the number of rows: "); int rows = scanner.nextInt(); System.out.print("Enter the number of columns: "); int columns = scanner.nextInt(); // Input the elements of the matrix int[][] matrix = inputMatrix(rows, columns, scanner); // Calculate and display the frequency of odd and even numbers int oddFrequency = 0; int evenFrequency = 0; for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) { for (int j = 0; j < columns; j++) { if (matrix[i][j] % 2 == 0) { evenFrequency++; } else { oddFrequency++; } } } System.out.println("Frequency of odd numbers: " + oddFrequency); System.out.println("Frequency of even numbers: " + evenFrequency); // Close the scanner scanner.close(); } public static int[][] inputMatrix(int rows, int columns, Scanner scanner) { System.out.println("Enter the elements of the matrix:"); int[][] matrix = new int[rows][columns]; for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) { for (int j = 0; j < columns; j++) { System.out.print("Enter element at position (" + (i + 1) + "," + (j + 1) + "): "); matrix[i][j] = scanner.nextInt(); } } return matrix; } }
output:
Enter the number of rows: 2
        Enter the number of columns: 3
        Enter the elements of the matrix:
        Enter element at position (1,1): 15
        Enter element at position (1,2): 2
        Enter element at position (1,3): 6
        Enter element at position (2,1): 48
        Enter element at position (2,2): 30
        Enter element at position (2,3): 12
        Frequency of odd numbers: 1
        Frequency of even numbers: 5

programName: Program to find the sum of each row and each column of a matrix
code: // Program to find the sum of each row and each column of a matrix import java.util.Scanner; public class program9 { public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in); // Input the size of the matrix System.out.print("Enter the number of rows: "); int rows = scanner.nextInt(); System.out.print("Enter the number of columns: "); int columns = scanner.nextInt(); // Input the elements of the matrix int[][] matrix = inputMatrix(rows, columns, scanner); // Calculate and display the sum of each row System.out.println("Sum of each row:"); for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) { int rowSum = 0; for (int j = 0; j < columns; j++) { rowSum += matrix[i][j]; } System.out.println("Row " + (i + 1) + ": " + rowSum); } // Calculate and display the sum of each column System.out.println("Sum of each column:"); for (int j = 0; j < columns; j++) { int columnSum = 0; for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) { columnSum += matrix[i][j]; } System.out.println("Column " + (j + 1) + ": " + columnSum); } // Close the scanner scanner.close(); } public static int[][] inputMatrix(int rows, int columns, Scanner scanner) { System.out.println("Enter the elements of the matrix:"); int[][] matrix = new int[rows][columns]; for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) { for (int j = 0; j < columns; j++) { System.out.print("Enter element at position (" + (i + 1) + "," + (j + 1) + "): "); matrix[i][j] = scanner.nextInt(); } } return matrix; } }
output:
Enter the number of rows: 2
Enter the number of columns: 3
Enter the elements of the matrix:
Enter element at position (1,1): 5
Enter element at position (1,2): 6
Enter element at position (1,3): 42
Enter element at position (2,1): 01
Enter element at position (2,2): 23
Enter element at position (2,3): 6
Sum of each row:
Row 1: 53
Row 2: 30
Sum of each column:
Column 1: 6
Column 2: 29
Column 3: 48

programName: Program to find the transpose of a given matrix
code: // Program to find the transpose of a given matrix public class program10 { public static void main(String[] args) { // Assume a 3x3 matrix for demonstration int[][] matrix = { {1, 2, 3}, {4, 5, 6}, {7, 8, 9} }; // Print the original matrix System.out.println("Original Matrix:"); printMatrix(matrix); // Calculate and display the transpose of the matrix int[][] transposeMatrix = transpose(matrix); System.out.println("Transpose Matrix:"); printMatrix(transposeMatrix); } public static int[][] transpose(int[][] matrix) { int rows = matrix.length; int columns = matrix[0].length; int[][] transposeMatrix = new int[columns][rows]; for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) { for (int j = 0; j < columns; j++) { transposeMatrix[j][i] = matrix[i][j]; } } return transposeMatrix; } public static void printMatrix(int[][] matrix) { for (int[] row : matrix) { for (int element : row) { System.out.print(element + " "); } System.out.println(); // Move to the next line for the next row } } }

programName: Program to determine whether a given matrix is an identity matrix
code: // Program to determine whether a given matrix is an identity matrix public class IdentityMatrixChecker { public static void main(String[] args) { int[][] matrix = { {1, 0, 0}, {0, 1, 0}, {0, 0, 1} }; if (isIdentityMatrix(matrix)) { System.out.println("The matrix is an identity matrix."); } else { System.out.println("The matrix is not an identity matrix."); } } public static boolean isIdentityMatrix(int[][] matrix) { int rows = matrix.length; int cols = (rows > 0) ? matrix[0].length : 0; // Check if the matrix is square if (rows != cols) { return false; } // Check diagonal elements for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) { for (int j = 0; j < cols; j++) { if (i == j && matrix[i][j] != 1) { return false; } else if (i != j && matrix[i][j] != 0) { return false; } } } // If all conditions are satisfied, the matrix is an identity matrix return true; } }
output: The matrix is an identity matrix.

programName: Program to determine whether a given matrix is a sparse matrix
code: // Program to determine whether a given matrix is a sparse matrix public class program13 { public static void main(String[] args) { // Assume a 3x3 matrix for demonstration int[][] matrix = { {1, 0, 0}, {0, 0, 0}, {0, 0, 2} }; // Print the matrix System.out.println("Given Matrix:"); printMatrix(matrix); // Check if the matrix is a sparse matrix boolean isSparse = isSparseMatrix(matrix); // Print the result if (isSparse) { System.out.println("The given matrix is a sparse matrix."); } else { System.out.println("The given matrix is not a sparse matrix."); } } public static boolean isSparseMatrix(int[][] matrix) { int rows = matrix.length; int columns = matrix[0].length; int zeroCount = 0; int nonZeroCount = 0; // Count the number of zeros and non-zeros for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) { for (int j = 0; j < columns; j++) { if (matrix[i][j] == 0) { zeroCount++; } else { nonZeroCount++; } } } // Check if the matrix is sparse based on the number of zeros return zeroCount > nonZeroCount; } public static void printMatrix(int[][] matrix) { for (int[] row : matrix) { for (int element : row) { System.out.print(element + " "); } System.out.println(); // Move to the next line for the next row } } }
output:
Given Matrix:
1       0       0
0       0       0
0       0       2
The given matrix is a sparse matrix.
